attributes.description: The M3 is a legend in the world of performance cars, causing enthusiasts to gush over its visceral engines and razor-sharp handling. That legend, by the way, started all the way back in 1986 when the first M3—a performance edition of the similarly beloved E30 3-series—hit the scene. Under the hood is a twin-turbo 3.0-litre inline-six that makes 425 horsepower making a glorious sounds all the way to its 7500-rpm redline. Features Include: M Double Clutch Transmision With Drivelogic, Rear View Camera, Rear Electric Roller Blind, Interior And Exterior Mirror With Automatic, Anti Dazzle Function, Automatic Anti Dazzle Interior Mirror, Smokers Package, Electric Memory Seat For Driver, Lumbar Support For, Driver And Front Passenger, Storage Compartment package, Park Distance Control Front And Rear, Rain Sensor And Automatic, Headlight Control, Cruise Control With Brake Function, Adaptive Led Headlights, Extended Light Package, High Beam Assist, Navigation System Professional, Intelligent Emergency Calling, Teleservices, Connected Drive Services, Real Time Traffic Information, Anthracite Roof Lining, Telematics And Online Service Provider Control, Mineral White Metallic, Leather Merino Extended Sakhir Orange, Adaptive M Suspension, 19''Double Spoke Alloy Wheels With Mixed Tyres, Comfort Access, Roller Sun Blind For Rear Side Windows, Interior Trim Finishers Carbon Fibre With Highlight Trim Black Chrome Finish, Heads Up Display, Harman Kardon Surround Sound System, Concierge Services

attributes.description: The Volkswagen Golf 8 GTI is a logical evolution of its predecessors from generation 5 onwards and while it doesn’t necessarily deliver outright driving thrills (sadly the new Clubsport isn’t coming to SA to plug that gap), it continues to impress as an all-rounder in most respects. It’s fast, yet dynamic and comfortable, grown up but still youthful enough to remind you of why you love cars in the first place. But perhaps a little more in the way of #vrrrpha would make this the perfect package. attributes.description: Mercedes-Benz has transformed its GLC lifestyle SUV from a practical soft-roader into a fashion accessory, but, given the market's sustained demand for vehicles, that's hardly a surprise. Well, let's cut to the chase: it's effectively a Mercedes-Benz GLC with the roof sloped down at the back so you get the coupe shape effect. It’s an SUV too, with decent ground clearance and an all-wheel drivetrain. This particular version is the GLC 250d Coupe, it's powered by a 2.1-litre turbodiesel engine mated with Mercedes-Benz's new generation 9-speed automatic transmission. Features: AMG Dynamic Select, Mercedes AMG Interior And Exterior, Parking Package, Mirror Package, Black Artico Man Made Leather, Remote Online, Smartphone Integration Mirror-link, Reversing Camera, Active Park Assist Parktronic, Collision Prevention Assist Plus, Double Cup Holder, Mercedes Benz Emergency Call System, Panoramic Sliding Sunroof, 9G Tronic Gearbox, Underbody Protection, Sports Suspension, Electrically Folding Exterior Mirrors, Thematic Automatic Climate Control, Entry/Exit Lighting In The Exterior Mirrors, Led High Performance Headlamps, 19''AMG 5 Twin Spoke Light Allow Wheels, Polished Aluminium Roof Rails, AMG Body-styling, Aluminium Look Running Boards With Rubber Studs, Interior Lighting Package, Easy Pack Tailgate, Exterior Chrome Package, Full Service History At Agents Motor-plan Till 27/03/2024 Or 100000KM.
